title.value: Agro-economic and energy effiency of barley fertilizer usage on antropogenic modified peat soils
Агроэкономическая и энергетическая эффективность применения удобрений под ячмень на антропогенно-преобразованных торфяных почвах

journal.title: Land Reclamation : scientific and practical journal

person.name: Semenenko, N.N., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute for Land Reclamation

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented data on the long-term field studies concerning the efficiency of different level for nitric, phosphoric and potassium fertilizers dosing in barley (Hordeum vulgare) crops grown on anthropogenically modified peat soils. Research results showed that in course of three years the application of mineral fertilizers promoted the increasing of yielding capacity of 17.2-21.3 centner /ha, reaching the level of 57.7 centener/ha, and during more favourable weather conditions – 71.1 center/ha. It is discovered that sufficiently high level of net produce 251,4 USD per hectare and profitability in amount of 41,9 % are obtained with adding 90 kilos nitric reactant per hectare against P80K120, provides crop capacity for barley at 57,7 centner for hectare. Using these variants of fertilizers usage energy profitability of 20,2 hecta J and high energy-conversion efficiency coefficient 1,3. Thus, in case of low soil provision with nitrogen the dose of N90 was the optimal one.
